summary.para: Finds occurrences of a type description in a type library. This may be used to quickly verify that a name exists in a type library.

param.name: szNameBuf
param.para: The name to search for.

param.name: lHashVal
param.para: A hash value to speed up the search, computed by the LHashValOfNameSys function. If lHashVal = 0, a value is computed.

param.name: ppTInfo
param.para: An array of pointers to the type descriptions that contain the name specified in szNameBuf. This parameter cannot be null.

param.name: rgMemId
param.para: An array of the found items; rgMemId[i] is the MEMBERID that indexes into the type description specified by ppTInfo[i]. This parameter cannot be null.

param.name: pcFound
param.para: On entry, indicates how many instances to look for. For example, *pcFound = 1 can be called to find the first occurrence. The search stops when one is found.
On exit, indicates the number of instances that were found. If the in and out values of *pcFound are identical, there may be more type descriptions that contain the name.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: Passing *pcFound = n indicates that there is enough room in the ppTInfo and rgMemId arrays for n (ptinfo, memid) pairs. The function returns MEMBERID_NIL in rgMemId[i], if the name in szNameBuf is the name of the type information in ppTInfo[i].

summary.para: Retrieves the documentation string for the library, the complete Help file name and path, and the context identifier for the library Help topic in the Help file.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the type description whose documentation is to be returned. If index is -1, then the documentation for the library itself is returned.

param.name: pBstrName
param.para: The name of the specified item. If the caller does not need the item name, then pBstrName can be null.

param.name: pBstrDocString
param.para: The documentation string for the specified item. If the caller does not need the documentation string, then pBstrDocString can be null..

param.name: pdwHelpContext
param.para: The Help context identifier (ID) associated with the specified item. If the caller does not need the Help context ID, then pdwHelpContext can be null.

param.name: pBstrHelpFile
param.para: The fully qualified name of the Help file. If the caller does not need the Help file name, then pBstrHelpFile can be null.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: The caller should free the parameters pBstrName, pBstrDocString, and pBstrHelpFile.

summary.para: Retrieves the structure that contains the library's attributes.

param.name: ppTLibAttr
param.para: The library's attributes.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: Use ITypeLib.ReleaseTLibAttr to free the memory occupied by the TLIBATTR structure.

summary.para: Enables a client compiler to bind to the types, variables, constants, and global functions for a library.

param.name: ppTComp
param.para: The ITypeComp instance for this ITypeLib. A client compiler uses the methods in the ITypeComp interface to bind to types in ITypeLib, as well as to the global functions, variables, and constants defined in ITypeLib

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: The function of the returned TypeComp binds to global functions, variables, constants, enumerated values, and coclass members. The Bind function also binds the names of the TYPEKIND enumerations of TKIND_MODULE, TKIND_ENUM, and TKIND_COCLASS. These names shadow any global names defined within the type information. The members of TKIND_ENUM, TKIND_MODULE, and TKIND_COCLASS types marked as Application objects can be directly bound to from ITypeComp without specifying the name of the module.

and ITypeComp.BindType accept only unqualified names. ITypeLib.GetTypeComp returns a pointer to the ITypeComp interface, which is then used to bind to global elements in the library. The names of some types (TKIND_ENUM, TKIND_MODULE, and TKIND_COCLASS) share the name space with variables, functions, constants, and enumerators.

If a member requires qualification to differentiate it from other items in the name space, GetTypeComp can be called successively for each qualifier in order to bind to the desired member. This allows programming language compilers to access members of modules, enumerations, and coclasses, even though the member can't be bound to with a qualified name.

summary.para: Retrieves the specified type description in the library.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the interface to be returned.

param.name: ppTInfo
param.para: If successful, returns a pointer to the pointer to the ITypeInfo interface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
The index parameter is outside the range of to GetTypeInfoCount - 1.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: For dual interfaces, GetTypeInfo returns only the TKIND_DISPATCH type information. To get the TKIND_INTERFACE type information, GetRefTypeOfImplType can be called on the TKIND_DISPATCH type information, passing an index of –1. Then, the returned type information handle can be passed to GetRefTypeInfo.
The following example gets the TKIND_INTERFACE type information for a dual interface.

summary.para: Provides the number of type descriptions that are in a type library.

returns.para: The number of type descriptions in the type library.

summary.para: Retrieves the type description that corresponds to the specified GUID.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID of the type description.

param.name: ppTinfo
param.para: The ITypeInfo interface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
No type description was found in the library with the specified GUID.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of a type description.

param.name: index
param.para: The index of the type description within the type library.

param.name: pTKind
param.para: The enumeration value for the type description.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
The index parameter is outside the range of to GetTypeInfoCount - 1.

summary.para: Indicates whether a passed-in string contains the name of a type or member described in the library.

param.name: szNameBuf
param.para: The string to test. If this method is successful, szNameBuf is modified to match the case (capitalization) found in the type library.

param.name: lHashVal
param.para: The hash value of szNameBuf.

param.name: pfName
param.para: True if szNameBuf was found in the type library; otherwise false.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Success.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.
Insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: Releases the TLIBATTR originally obtained from GetLibAttr.

param.name: pTLibAttr
param.para: The TLIBATTR to be freed.

summary.para: Represents a type library, the data that describes a set of objects. A type library can be a stand-alone binary file (.TLB), a resource in a dynamic link library or executable file (.DLL, .OLB, or .EXE).

remarks.para: The system registry contains a list of all the installed type libraries. Type library organization is illustrated in the following figure:
.:image type="content" source="./images/oa03_10.Png" border="false" alt-text="Diagram showing the organization of installed type libraries as they are listed in the system registry.".:
The ITypeLib interface provides methods for accessing a library of type descriptions. This interface supports the following:

description.para: Generalized containment for type information. ITypeLib allows iteration over the type descriptions contained in the library.

Global functions and data. A type library can contain descriptions of a set of modules (.DLLs) that exports data and functions. The type library supports compiling references to the exported data and functions.
General information, including a user-readable name for the library and help for the library as a whole.
